First of all, sorry for the Jaden Smith title, I wasn't sure what to capitalize and what not to. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

So, how does hover mode work on the helicopter rotor? I didn't get to binding it to action groups but I did it in the right click menu and it didn't do anything. In the video that the KAX Dev made about it, he used action groups to treat his hover mode as the collective and the throttle as main engine throttle. Now I'll admit I don't know helicopters well, but I do know that he throttled up and lifted high off the ground then turned on hover mode and it leveled off and gave control of the altitude, but mine doesn't, it's still completely controlled by throttle. D:

I'll try action groups and let you know how it goes.

Thanks for your help!

-Slab

EDIT: Ok, I added action groups for toggle hover, and decrease/increase hover altitude and it had no effect at all. I looked at the Right-click menu and the buttons are changing the hover height number, but it's not having any effect. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-07T21:55:37Z" title="04/07/2015 09:55  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 7, 2015</time> by SlabGizor117**

[KAX is here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76668-0-90-Kerbal-Aircraft-Expansion-%28KAX%29-v2-3-4)
